verses.text: If a man steals an ox or a sheep, and kills it or sells it, he shall repay five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep.
verses.comment: The Hebrew indicates restitution higher than the value of what was stolen.

verses.text: If a thief is found breaking in, and is struck so that he dies, there shall be no guilt of bloodshed for him.
verses.comment: The Hebrew 'breaking in' refers to housebreaking.

verses.text: But if the sun has risen on him, there is guilt of bloodshed. He must make full restitution; if he has nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.
verses.comment: 'Sold for his theft' means slavery as a penalty.

verses.text: If the stolen animal—whether ox, donkey, or sheep—is found alive in his possession, he shall pay double.
verses.comment: Restitution doubles for live recovery.

verses.text: If a man lets a field or vineyard be grazed over, and lets his animal loose, and it feeds in another man's field, he shall make restitution from the best of his own field and the best of his own vineyard.
verses.comment: The principle is full restitution from the best produce.

verses.text: If a fire breaks out and spreads to thorns, so that stacked grain, standing grain, or a field is consumed, he who started the fire shall make full restitution.
verses.comment: Liability for accidental fire damage.

verses.text: If a man gives his neighbor money or belongings to keep, and it is stolen from the neighbor's house, if the thief is found, he shall pay double.
verses.comment: Theft under safekeeping incurs double restitution.

verses.text: If the thief is not found, the owner of the house shall come near to God to show whether he has not put his hand to his neighbor's goods.
verses.comment: 'God' here refers to appearing before the judges or at the sanctuary.

verses.text: In every case of transgression—whether for ox, donkey, sheep, clothing, or for any kind of lost thing, about which one says, 'This is it,'—the case of both parties shall come before God. Whoever God declares guilty shall pay double to his neighbor.
verses.comment: Law courts determined guilt, standing in for 'God' in context.

verses.text: If a man gives to his neighbor a donkey, ox, sheep, or any animal to keep, and it dies or is hurt or driven away, and no one sees it,
verses.comment: Covers unsupervised loss cases.

verses.text: then there shall be an oath before the LORD between the two, to see whether he has not put his hand to his neighbor's property. The owner shall accept it, and the other shall not make restitution.
verses.comment: Swearing an oath before the LORD settles the case if no evidence.

verses.text: But if it is stolen from him, he shall make restitution to the owner.
verses.comment: Responsibility if stolen under safekeeping.

verses.text: If it is torn by beasts, let him bring it as evidence. He need not make good what was torn.
verses.comment: Exception if loss is proved to be from wild animals.

verses.text: If a man borrows anything from his neighbor, and it is injured or dies, while the owner is not with it, he must make restitution.
verses.comment: Responsibility is on the borrower.

verses.text: But if the owner was with it, he shall not make restitution; if it was hired, it came for its hire.
verses.comment: Presence of the owner changes liability.

verses.text: If a man seduces a virgin who is not betrothed, and lies with her, he must pay the bride-price for her, and make her his wife.
verses.comment: 'Bride-price' refers to the customary marriage payment.

verses.text: If her father absolutely refuses to give her to him, he must pay money equal to the bride-price for virgins.
verses.comment: Marriage is not forced but payment is still owed.

verses.text: You shall not allow a sorceress to live.
verses.comment: 'Sorceress' translates the female noun in Hebrew. Applies magistrate penalty for sorcery.

verses.text: Whoever lies with an animal shall surely be put to death.
verses.comment: Bestiality carried a death sentence.

verses.text: Whoever sacrifices to any god, except to the LORD only, shall be devoted to destruction.
verses.comment: 'Devoted to destruction' means put under the ban (total destruction or execution).

verses.text: You shall not mistreat or oppress a foreigner, for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt.
verses.comment: 'Foreigner' means sojourner or resident alien.

verses.text: You shall not afflict any widow or fatherless child.
verses.comment: Specific care commanded to protect the vulnerable.

verses.text: If you do afflict them, and they cry out to Me, I will surely hear their cry,
verses.comment: God promises to respond to the oppressed.

verses.text: and My wrath will burn, and I will kill you with the sword, and your wives shall become widows and your children fatherless.
verses.comment: God himself will execute judgment for the oppressed.

verses.text: If you lend money to any of My people with you who is poor, you shall not be to him as a creditor, and you shall not charge him interest.
verses.comment: Hebrew law prohibits usury among Israelites.

verses.text: If you ever take your neighbor’s cloak as a pledge, you shall return it to him before the sun goes down,
verses.comment: A poor man’s cloak could not be retained overnight.

verses.text: for that is his only covering; it is his cloak for his body. In what else will he sleep? And when he cries to Me, I will hear, for I am compassionate.
verses.comment: Compassion is the rationale for this law.

verses.text: You shall not curse God, nor curse a ruler of your people.
verses.comment: 'God'—the Hebrew is plural but refers here to God, not judges.

verses.text: You shall not delay to offer from the fullness of your harvest and from the outflow of your presses. You shall give Me the firstborn of your sons.
verses.comment: 'Fullness' and 'outflow' refer to grain and wine/oil.

verses.text: You shall do the same with your oxen and with your sheep: seven days it shall be with its mother; on the eighth day you shall give it to Me.
verses.comment: Applies also to firstborn livestock.

verses.text: You shall be holy men to Me; therefore, you shall not eat any flesh that is torn by beasts in the field; you shall throw it to the dogs.
verses.comment: Holiness relates to diet and ritual purity.
